refnamediv.refpurpose: STUN messages parsing and formatting functions

refentry.refsect1: Stability Level Stable, unless otherwise indicated

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The STUN Messages API allows you to create STUN messages easily as well as to parse existing messages.

refsect2.title: StunMessage
refsect2.para: This structure represents a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The agent that created or validated this message
The buffer containing the STUN message
The length of the buffer (not the size of the message)
The short term credentials key to use for authentication validation or that was used to finalize this message
The length of the associated key
The long term credential key to use for authentication validation or that was used to finalize this message
Whether or not the long_term_key variable contains valid data

refsect2.title: enum StunClass
refsect2.para: This enum is used to represent the class of a STUN message, as defined in RFC5389

listitem.simpara: A STUN Request message
A STUN indication message
A STUN Response message
A STUN Error message

refsect2.title: enum StunMethod
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { STUN_BINDING=0x001, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_SHARED_SECRET=0x002, /* old RFC3489 */ STUN_ALLOCATE=0x003, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_SET_ACTIVE_DST=0x004, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_REFRESH=0x004, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_SEND=0x004, /* TURN-00 */ STUN_CONNECT=0x005, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_OLD_SET_ACTIVE_DST=0x006, /* TURN-00 */ STUN_IND_SEND=0x006, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_IND_DATA=0x007, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_IND_CONNECT_STATUS=0x008, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_CREATEPERMISSION= 0x008, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_CHANNELBIND= 0x009 /* TURN-12 */ } StunMethod;
refsect2.para: This enum is used to represent the method of a STUN message, as defined by various RFCs

listitem.simpara: The Binding method as defined by the RFC5389
The Shared-Secret method as defined by the RFC3489
The Allocate method as defined by the TURN draft 12
The Set-Active-Destination method as defined by the TURN draft 4
The Refresh method as defined by the TURN draft 12
The Send method as defined by the TURN draft 00
The Connect method as defined by the TURN draft 4
The older Set-Active-Destination method as defined by the TURN draft 0
The Send method used in indication messages as defined by the TURN draft 12
The Data method used in indication messages as defined by the TURN draft 12
The Connect-Status method used in indication messages as defined by the TURN draft 4
The CreatePermission method as defined by the TURN draft 12
The ChannelBind method as defined by the TURN draft 12

refsect2.title: enum StunAttribute
refsect2.para: Known STUN attribute types as defined by various RFCs and drafts

listitem.simpara: The MAPPED-ADDRESS attribute as defined by RFC5389
The RESPONSE-ADDRESS attribute as defined by RFC3489
The CHANGE-REQUEST attribute as defined by RFC3489
The SOURCE-ADDRESS attribute as defined by RFC3489
The CHANGED-ADDRESS attribute as defined by RFC3489
The USERNAME attribute as defined by RFC5389
The PASSWORD attribute as defined by RFC3489
The MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute as defined by RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE attribute as defined by RFC5389
The UNKNOWN-ATTRIBUTES attribute as defined by RFC5389
The REFLECTED-FROM attribute as defined by RFC3489
The CHANNEL-NUMBER attribute as defined by TURN draft 09 and 12
The LIFETIME attribute as defined by TURN draft 04, 09 and 12
The MAGIC-COOKIE attribute as defined by the rosenberg-midcom TURN draft 08
The BANDWIDTH attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The DESTINATION-ADDRESS attribute as defined by the rosenberg-midcom TURN draft 08
The REMOTE-ADDRESS attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The PEER-ADDRESS attribute as defined by TURN draft 09
The XOR-PEER-ADDRESS attribute as defined by TURN draft 12
The DATA attribute as defined by TURN draft 04, 09 and 12
The REALM attribute as defined by RFC5389
The NONCE attribute as defined by RFC5389
The RELAY-ADDRESS attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The RELAYED-ADDRESS attribute as defined by TURN draft 09
The XOR-RELAYED-ADDRESS attribute as defined by TURN draft 12
The REQUESTED-ADDRESS-TYPE attribute as defined by TURN-IPV6 draft 05
The REQUESTED-PORT-PROPS attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The REQUESTED-PROPS attribute as defined by TURN draft 09
The EVEN-PORT attribute as defined by TURN draft 12
The REQUESTED-TRANSPORT attribute as defined by TURN draft 12
The DONT-FRAGMENT attribute as defined by TURN draft 12
The XOR-MAPPED-ADDRESS attribute as defined by RFC5389
The TIMER-VAL attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The REQUESTED-IP attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The RESERVATION-TOKEN attribute as defined by TURN draft 09 and 12
The CONNECT-STAT attribute as defined by TURN draft 04
The PRIORITY attribute as defined by ICE draft 19
The USE-CANDIDATE attribute as defined by ICE draft 19
The OPTIONS optional attribute as defined by libjingle
The SOFTWARE optional attribute as defined by RFC5389
The ALTERNATE-SERVER optional attribute as defined by RFC5389
The FINGERPRINT optional attribute as defined by RFC5389
The ICE-CONTROLLED optional attribute as defined by ICE draft 19
The ICE-CONTROLLING optional attribute as defined by ICE draft 19

refsect2.title: StunTransactionId
refsect2.para: A type that holds a STUN transaction id.

refsect2.title: enum StunError
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { STUN_ERROR_TRY_ALTERNATE=300, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_ERROR_BAD_REQUEST=400, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED=401, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ATTRIBUTE=420, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_ERROR_ALLOCATION_MISMATCH=437, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_ERROR_STALE_NONCE=438, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_ERROR_ACT_DST_ALREADY=439, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FAMILY=440, /* TURN-IPv6-05 */ STUN_ERROR_WRONG_CREDENTIALS=441, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_TRANSPORT=442, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_ERROR_INVALID_IP=443, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_ERROR_INVALID_PORT=444, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_ERROR_OP_TCP_ONLY=445, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_ERROR_CONN_ALREADY=446, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_ERROR_ALLOCATION_QUOTA_REACHED=486, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_ERROR_ROLE_CONFLICT=487, /* ICE-19 */ STUN_ERROR_SERVER_ERROR=500, /* RFC5389 */ STUN_ERROR_SERVER_CAPACITY=507, /* TURN-04 */ STUN_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_CAPACITY=508, /* TURN-12 */ STUN_ERROR_MAX=699 } StunError;
refsect2.para: STUN error codes as defined by various RFCs and drafts

listitem.simpara: The ERROR-CODE value for the "Try Alternate" error as defined in RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Bad Request" error as defined in RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Unauthorized" error as defined in RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Unknown Attribute" error as defined in RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Allocation Mismatch" error as defined in TURN draft 12. Equivalent to the "No Binding" error defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Stale Nonce" error as defined in RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Active Destination Already Set" error as defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Address Family not Supported" error as defined in TURN IPV6 Draft 05.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Wrong Credentials" error as defined in TURN Draft 12.
he ERROR-CODE value for the "Unsupported Transport Protocol" error as defined in TURN Draft 12.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Invalid IP Address" error as defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Invalid Port" error as defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Operation for TCP Only" error as defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Connection Already Exists" error as defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Allocation Quota Reached" error as defined in TURN draft 12.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Role Conflict" error as defined in ICE draft 19.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Server Error" error as defined in RFC5389
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Insufficient Capacity" error as defined in TURN draft 04.
The ERROR-CODE value for the "Insufficient Capacity" error as defined in TURN draft 12.
The maximum possible ERROR-CODE value as defined by RFC 5389.

refsect2.title: enum StunMessageReturn
refsect2.para: The return value of most stun_message_* functions. This enum will report on whether an operation was successful or not and what error occured if any.

listitem.simpara: The operation was successful
The attribute was not found
The argument or data is invalid
There is not enough space in the message to append data to it, or not enough in an argument to fill it with the data requested.
The address in the arguments or in the STUN message is not supported.

refsect2.title: STUN_MESSAGE_BUFFER_INCOMPLETE
refsect2.programlisting: #define STUN_MESSAGE_BUFFER_INCOMPLETE
refsect2.para: Convenience macro for stun_message_validate_buffer_length() meaning that the data to validate does not hold a complete STUN message

refsect2.title: STUN_MESSAGE_BUFFER_INVALID
refsect2.programlisting: #define STUN_MESSAGE_BUFFER_INVALID
refsect2.para: Convenience macro for stun_message_validate_buffer_length() meaning that the data to validate is not a valid STUN message

refsect2.title: stun_message_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: bool stun_message_init (StunMessage *msg, StunClass c, StunMethod m, const StunTransactionId id);
refsect2.para: Initializes a STUN message buffer, with no attributes.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage to initialize
STUN message class (host byte order)
STUN message method (host byte order)
16-bytes transaction ID
TRUE if the initialization was successful

refsect2.title: stun_message_length ()
refsect2.programlisting: uint16_t stun_message_length (const StunMessage *msg);
refsect2.para: Get the length of the message (including the header)

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The length of the message

refsect2.title: stun_message_find ()
refsect2.para: Finds an attribute in a STUN message and fetches its content

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
A pointer to store the length of the attribute
A pointer to the start of the attribute payload if found, otherwise NULL.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find_flag ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_find_flag (const StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type);
refsect2.para: Looks for a flag attribute within a valid STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute's size is not zero.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find32 ()
refsect2.para: Extracts a 32-bits attribute from a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
A pointer where to store the value (host byte order)
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute's size is not 4 bytes.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find64 ()
refsect2.para: Extracts a 64-bits attribute from a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
A pointer where to store the value (host byte order)
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute's size is not 8 bytes.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_find_string (const StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, char *buf, size_t buflen);
refsect2.para: Extracts an UTF-8 string from a valid STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
A pointer where to store the data
The length of the buffer

A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute is improperly encoded STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE is return if the buffer size is too small to hold the string
The string will be NULL-terminated.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find_addr ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_find_addr (const StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t *addrlen);
refsect2.para: Extracts a network address attribute from a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
The sockaddr to be filled
The size of the addr variable. Will be set to the size of the extracted socket address.

A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute payload size is wrong or if the addrlen is too small STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_ADDRESSS if the address family is unknown.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find_xor_addr ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_find_xor_addr (const StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t *addrlen);
refsect2.para: Extracts an obfuscated network address attribute from a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
The sockaddr to be filled
The size of the addr variable. Will be set to the size of the extracted socket address.

A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute payload size is wrong or if the addrlen is too small STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_ADDRESSS if the address family is unknown.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find_xor_addr_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_find_xor_addr_full (const StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t *addrlen, uint32_t magic_cookie);
refsect2.para: Extracts an obfuscated network address attribute from a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to find
The sockaddr to be filled
The size of the addr variable. Will be set to the size of the extracted socket address.
The magic cookie to use to XOR the address.

A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the attribute payload size is wrong or if the addrlen is too small STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_ADDRESSS if the address family is unknown.

refsect2.title: stun_message_find_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_find_error (const StunMessage *msg, int *code);
refsect2.para: Extract the error response code from a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
A pointer where to store the value
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the value is invalid

refsect2.title: stun_message_append ()
refsect2.para: Reserves room for appending an attribute to an unfinished STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The length of the attribute
A pointer to an unitialized buffer of length bytes to where the attribute payload must be written, or NULL if there is not enough room in the STUN message buffer.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_append_bytes (StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, const void *data, size_t len);
refsect2.para: Appends a binary value to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The data to append
The length of the attribute
A StunMessageReturn value.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_flag ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_append_flag (StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type);
refsect2.para: Appends an empty flag attribute to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
A StunMessageReturn value.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append32 ()
refsect2.para: Appends a 32-bits value attribute to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The value to append (host byte order)
A StunMessageReturn value.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append64 ()
refsect2.para: Appends a 64-bits value attribute to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The value to append (host byte order)
A StunMessageReturn value.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_string ()
refsect2.para: Adds an attribute from a NULL-terminated string to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The string to append
A StunMessageReturn value.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_addr ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_append_addr (StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, const struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t addrlen);
refsect2.para: Append a network address attribute to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The sockaddr to be append
The size of the addr variable.
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the addrlen is too small STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_ADDRESSS if the address family is unknown.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_xor_addr ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_append_xor_addr (StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, const struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t addrlen);
refsect2.para: Append an obfuscated network address attribute to a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The sockaddr to be append
The size of the addr variable.
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the addrlen is too small STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_ADDRESSS if the address family is unknown.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_xor_addr_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_append_xor_addr_full (StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type, const struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t addrlen, uint32_t magic_cookie);
refsect2.para: Append an obfuscated network address attribute from a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to append
The sockaddr to be append
The size of the addr variable.
The magic cookie to use to XOR the address.
A StunMessageReturn value. STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_INVALID is returned if the addrlen is too small STUN_MESSAGE_RETURN_UNSUPPORTED_ADDRESSS if the address family is unknown.

refsect2.title: stun_message_append_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMessageReturn stun_message_append_error (StunMessage *msg, StunError code);
refsect2.para: Appends the ERROR-CODE attribute to the STUN message and fills it according to code

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The error code value
A StunMessageReturn value.

refsect2.title: stun_message_validate_buffer_length ()
refsect2.programlisting: int stun_message_validate_buffer_length (const uint8_t *msg, size_t length);
refsect2.para: This function will take a data buffer and will try to validate whether it is a STUN message or if it's not or if it's an incomplete STUN message and will provide us with the length of the STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The buffer to validate
The length of the buffer

The length of the valid STUN message in the buffer.
See also: STUN_MESSAGE_BUFFER_INCOMPLETE
See also: STUN_MESSAGE_BUFFER_INVALID

refsect2.title: stun_message_id ()
refsect2.programlisting: void stun_message_id (const StunMessage *msg, StunTransactionId id);
refsect2.para: Retreive the STUN transaction id from a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunTransactionId to fill

refsect2.title: stun_message_get_class ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunClass stun_message_get_class (const StunMessage *msg);
refsect2.para: Retreive the STUN class from a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunClass

refsect2.title: stun_message_get_method ()
refsect2.programlisting: StunMethod stun_message_get_method (const StunMessage *msg);
refsect2.para: Retreive the STUN method from a STUN message

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunMethod

refsect2.title: stun_message_has_attribute ()
refsect2.programlisting: bool stun_message_has_attribute (const StunMessage *msg, StunAttribute type);
refsect2.para: Checks if an attribute is present within a STUN message.

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
The StunAttribute to look for
TRUE if the attribute is found, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: stun_message_has_cookie ()
refsect2.programlisting: bool stun_message_has_cookie (const StunMessage *msg);
refsect2.para: Checks if the STUN message has a RFC5389 compatible cookie

listitem.simpara: The StunMessage
TRUE if the cookie is present, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: stun_optional ()
refsect2.programlisting: bool stun_optional (uint16_t t);
refsect2.para: Helper function that checks whether a STUN attribute is a mandatory or an optional attribute

listitem.simpara: An attribute type
TRUE if the attribute is an optional one

refsect2.title: stun_strerror ()
refsect2.programlisting: const char* stun_strerror (StunError code);
refsect2.para: Transforms a STUN error-code into a human readable string

listitem.simpara: host-byte order error code
A static pointer to a NULL-terminated error message string.
